Ad Text:
Company description:



CAPGEMINI SERVICE SAS



Job description:

Let's talk about the Team

Cloud & Custom Applications (CCA) combine design and technology with modern delivery methodologies to deliver experience oriented, scalable, sustainable and secure enterprise solutions. We are tech savvy consultants on a journey to deliver innovation and expertise to our clients. Join a collaborative team that is solution focused and empower each other to be their best.
We are well known for our work on modern web applications; we are involved at all stages of the software delivery lifecycle from ideation through implementation to deployment. We're also strong on integrations, IoT, cloud migrations and app modernisation.

Let's Talk About The Role & Responsibilities

We're looking for a confident and experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our dynamic consultancy team in Wellington. This is a fantastic opportunity to work on large-scale, high-impact projects that shape business and technology outcomes for our clients.

As a Senior BA, you'll be the vital link between business needs and technical solutions. You'll bring clarity to complexity, working closely with stakeholders to define requirements, guide delivery, and ensure solutions are fit-for-purpose and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities
Act as the bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring clear understanding and alignment of requirements.
Collaborate with project teams to break down deliverables into actionable activities and milestones.
Lead the analysis and definition of configuration specifications and business technology requirements.
Support the Solution Architect by clarifying business needs and contributing to solution design.
Engage with customers to co-design best practices and system functionality guidelines.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of technical and business information.
Support the full development lifecycle, from discovery through to delivery.
Take ownership of all business analysis activities required to fulfil project deliverables.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders, fostering trust and collaboration across diverse teams.
About You
Proven experience as a Senior Business Analyst in a consultancy or client-facing environment.
Hands on Scrum Master experience is required
Exceptional stakeholder engagement and communication skills.
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.
Comfortable working in fast-paced, complex project environments.
Experience supporting solution architecture and development lifecycles.
A proactive, collaborative approach with a focus on delivering value.



Profile description:



Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organisations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of 22.5 billion Euro.



We offer:



Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you'd like, where you'll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you'll be able to reimagine what's possible. Join us and help the world's leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Category:

Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Are you a strategic portfolio performance and insights leader with a passion for building new capability and driving evidence-based decision-making at scale?

This is a newly established role, positioned within the Portfolio Management Office (PfMO) of the Infrastructure Services Division (ISD), Department of Education.

In this role, you will lead the development and ongoing management of portfolio performance analysis and monitoring for the Department's Infrastructure Investment Portfolio (IIP), supporting improved 'on-time and on-budget' delivery outcomes across a multi-billion-dollar capital program.

This role is pivotal in strengthening executive and governance decision-making by enhancing the rigour, maturity, and transparency of portfolio performance analysis across the Infrastructure Investment Portfolio (IIP).

About the Department 

Working for the Queensland Department of Education means joining an organisation that values its people and promotes leadership and innovation. Be part of an environment that respects professionalism and diversity, offers training and development opportunities and embraces flexible careers and work-life balance. Find out more about working with us.

Your Opportunity

To enhance portfolio governance, performance oversight, and investment decision-making, ISD is strengthening the Portfolio Management Office (PfMO) to provide a more integrated, transparent, and insight-driven view of portfolio performance.

As the Manager of the Portfolio Performance & Insights (PPI) team, you will be responsible for establishing and leading a new portfolio performance and insights function within the PMO.

You will work will closely with various teams across the division to provide a holistic view of planning and delivery performance, combining financial reporting with non-financial measures such as schedule, risk, benefits, dependencies, and capacity, enabling proactive portfolio management and early intervention to ensure informed decision-making and strengthened portfolio oversight.

Initial focus includes:

Establishing the function - defining frameworks, measures and operating model to support the portfolio performance and insight's function
Portfolio performance and insight - Identifying and communicating portfolio-level trends, emerging risks, constraints, and opportunities to support proactive management of the Infrastructure Investment Portfolio.
Executive reporting and governance - Designing and implementing portfolio-level performance monitoring frameworks and executive-level reporting to inform, challenge, and influence executive and governance investment decisions.
Capability uplift – Leading the uplift of capability in portfolio, program, and project performance analysis and monitoring across the division.

About You

This role will suit a strategic, analytical professional who is motivated by building new capability and driving measurable performance improvement at scale. You will thrive in this role if you:

enjoy operating at the intersection of data, delivery, and executive decision-making
can operate effectively in environments with evolving direction and bring structure that enables confident decision-making
can balance strategic thinking with a pragmatic approach to achieving outcomes
are confident in building relationships and influencing senior stakeholders using evidence and judgement
have advanced knowledge of, and experience leading, infrastructure portfolio, program, and project performance monitoring in a government or large, complex organisational environment
are proficient in reporting, data analysis, and visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, Excel) to effectively communicate portfolio performance and trends.

Formal qualifications in business, economics, data analytics, or project/portfolio management are beneficial. Experience with capital investment portfolios, Government investment and assurance frameworks, and P3M methodologies will be highly regarded.

How to Apply

A brief resume with contact details of 2 referees (including your current manager)
A maximum 2-page statement outlining:
Motivation to apply for this role
clear, concise examples demonstrating capability in driving performance improvement and organisational change, demonstrating how you have uplifted maturity, delivered outcomes, and influenced decision-making across complex environments
Your people leadership experience, including alignment with the Leadership Competencies for Queensland and how your personal attributes align with this requirements.

We welcome all applicants to share any support needed to ensure our recruitment process is inclusive. 

Applications remain current for 12 months from the closing date and may be considered for appointment to identical or similar vacancies within the Department. 

Applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.
